team.title: Chief Executive Officer
team.name: Guillem Singla Buxarrais
team.bioHtml: CEO @Neurofenix. We make stroke rehabilitation fun and accessible.

team.title: CTO
team.name: Dimitris Athanasiou
team.bioHtml: CTO @Neurofenix. Superb engineering background that combines hardware & software dev skills with clinical expertise. Worked at Lightpoint, Imperial, Demokritos.

team.title: Chief Executive Officer
team.name: Guillem Singla Buxarrais
team.bioHtml: CEO @Neurofenix. We make stroke rehabilitation fun and accessible.

team.name: Raquel Acitores Bermejo
team.bioHtml: Computer engineer with the speciality in software. Finalist of Microsoft Imagine Cup 2007 Spain. Launched successful Android App used for major media companies

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
We are looking for a driven, creative and a non-stop Software Engineer who has a ton of passion for creating & gamifying experiences. In addition to writing excellent code, you are also expected to help us in making decisions, designing and implementing features and be involved in other aspects of product development.

MISSION
Neurofenix is a purpose-driven start-up company determined to improve the lives of stroke survivors. Our award-winning digital rehabilitation platform strives to be the most engaging training system on the market, empowering stroke survivors to regain movement and independence. Our product won UK’s Best Invention 2018 and saw us featured in Sky News!

Lorna, stroke survivor's wife - “The NeuroBall is definitely helping my husband with rehab and it's something the kids enjoy watching as they feel their dad is now a gamer!".

THE ROLE
- Self-motivated and takes the initiative to change what you believe is not right
- Team player who appreciates both giving and receiving feedback
- Taking the responsibility of the full development process of features
- Working well alone and in a team

REQUIRED SKILLS
- 2+ years working experience
- You speak OOP and Design Patterns fluently. You write well-structured code
- Experience working in a client-server environment. Knowledge of how API and network-based operations work
- Has a working knowledge of mobile game development (iOS and Android)
- Experience with GitHub
- Excellent communication skills and attitude
- Performance-aware and what works in Unity and what’s not

YOU ARE AWESOME IF YOU
- Have previous experience with Unity
- Having built/worked and launched one or more mobile games on iOS and Android
- Know what Dependency Injection (DI) and Inversion of Control (IoC) is
- Worked with a RESTFUL API or GraphQL
- Have An eye for good design practices and beautiful art 
- Have experience with UI/UX
- Have ever heard of Fitts’s law? You know what it is and design accordingly

WHAT WE OFFER
- The opportunity to take a key role from an early stage of the start-up business and a rapid career progression in the growing field of rehabilitation technology
- Be part of a talented and friendly multidisciplinary team of engineers, product designers, marketers, and clinicians with over 20 years of experience
- A competitive salary of £30,000 to £50,000 per annum based on experience
- Enrollment on our pension scheme, sick pay and generous holiday entitlement
- Free coffee & tea and everything you need to succeed within our office, one minute walk from Old Street Station in central London
- Meetups, happy-hours, team social activities (ping pong, go-karting, wine & chocolate tasting) and more!
